ratings.comment: Very clear lecture logic and content. If you attend class carefully, you shouldn't have any problems with your homework. The exam is very simple, and a lot of materials are given to review before the exam. The professor is very, very good. I got sick during class, and the professor was very concerned about my situation and gave me homework grace

Would definitely take this class again! The lectures were very clear and to the point. This class had a lot of resources for help like the anki flashcards, TA's and the professor herself was very helpful. Overall, I really liked the professor, and I would say she's one of the best I've had.

Meena was very accessible outside class and gave lots of help during office hours. Also granted deadline extensions pretty generously. I didn't like her lecturing style the first couple weeks, but I realized that during lecture, she's pretty much going over exactly what we're supposed to do for that week's homework, which I found really helpful.

I think Meena rubs many people the wrong way, but I really liked her as a professor. Her lecture code is super helpful for projects. Super lenient and flexible and always willing to extend deadlines for a project if necessary. Exams are easy and open-note. The weekly quizzes are online and you can use any resource.
The worst structured class/projects I have ever taken. Also lectures was just watching her put codes into a terminal.

Are you passionate about data science? Are you enrolling in this class with the goal of learning its content? Do you expect receiving meaningful responses from the instructor? If that's the case, it's highly advisable to avoid taking a class with Meena.
Meena is not good at teaching. Make sure the class has knowledgeable TAs.

Lectures were somehow rushed and redundant at the same time. There is simply too much material in this class for a 15-week course. It's manageable though, as long as you know what you're getting in to. I have so much respect for Meena; she taught this class towards the end of her pregnancy!

Meena is not a suitable option if your goal is to learn content of CS220. She does not explain concepts very well and struggles with teaching fundamentals. I would recommend taking the class with Andy or ensuring that the class has good TAs. Meena tends to confuse rather than facilitate learning.
Meena is very respectful but is a poor teacher. I do not recommend her for CS220.
She is not a good teacher. She goes very fast during the lecture without explaining well. All the work is done by TAs.

No longer teaches cs220 as of 2023 but was one of two professors in who taught the course. Meena knows the content of python very well and goes fast as a result but will expect you to keep up in lecture. She goes VERY fast over content that needs to be described in detail. She does structure notes in a way that is helpful for projects/exams/quizzes

The lecture structure of this course starts off very manageable, but the pace picks up quickly to a point that towards the end I really struggled to keep up during class. The lectures are tricky to go and piece together after the fact, even having attended lecture. The class is project heavy, but they are very manageable if you begin on time.

She doesn't seem to understand the teacher-student dynamic very well, which makes for many awkward moments during lectures. She does care a good deal about the material, which sometimes makes her lecture engaging.

Meena isn't amazing but structures the class in a way you can succeed. Her lectures were fast and hard to understand so I skipped them and completed the lecture code on my own. The class is project heavy but is more manageable with a reliable partner. You will learn a lot if you put in the effort but too many expect it to be easy and complain.

I found Meena's lectures to be awful. She moves too fast and overcomplicates nearly everything she tries to explain. She shows no capacity for understanding that the weekly project deadlines are extremely hard to manage for many beginning coders. I got through the class with a tutor, but she had the audacity to tell me tutoring wasn't necessary.
If I could give here negative stars I would. Straight up B****.

Meena is not a bad professor, it's the course that's tedious and I would not recommend taking it if you have a hard time with project-based assignments instead of exam-based. However, you could tell meena loves to teach and respects her students. Overall cool~

Instead of waiting for kids to stop talking or talking over them, she has tried other methods, like tapping on the mic and playing music. However, she really cares about her students and tries her best to set them up for success. I think the projects in this class were pretty fun and not too difficult honestly. If you them, you'll do well enough.

She has recently decided to start playing music before class to get students to be quiet, even when class hasn't officially started. This backfired last week when the speaker had a stroke and all 400 kids in the rooms were violently forced to listen to a high pitch squeal for 30 seconds because Meenakshi didn't stop the music. I am now deaf.
Overall just not a good professor. Do not take !!
Amazing professor. Made CS 220 enjoyable and would definitely take again.

I haven't heard a single person say they enjoyed CS220. The class is extremely project heavy. A project was due every week and some took me up to 10 hours to finish. The amount of contents covered and her thick accent  overwhelmed me and made me stop attending lectures + watch her old lecture videos on YouTube (since they have subtitles) instead.

Great proff! Super accessible outside of class - I emailed her a few times and she always responded so quickly and was always very kind and understanding. All readings, lectures, etc were posted online which was very helpful to look back on. Didn't put an insane amount of effort in & got an A.

Moves way too fast. Unable to explain concepts or answer questions effectively. Not a good teacher at all. However, all sections are synchronized togeather and cover same stuff so can learn by attending other lectures and other Professors explain things really well.

CS220 is a super useful and interesting class. Professor Meena is a really nice person. Her lectures are good but sometimes a bit too fast and not explained thoroughly enough.  I believe all professors share the same materials, projects, quizzes, etc. All instructions for projects are clear and give past papers to review. Good class and prof.
Meena genuinely cares about her students and gives decent lectures. Overall a great professor who is pretty responsive to an online heavy class.
Terrible lectures.

Meena is one of the better CS professors at UW. She puts a ton of thought into her exams and projects and runs a well-designed class. She's responsive to questions and is quick to correct issues. She's also very personable. My only criticism would be that some of the projects were a bit too easy.
The easiest lecture she gave us is the Python installation video :( Her lectures are very fast and difficult to understand, so be prepared to follow her pace.

The course contents and projects are mostly designed by either TAs or instructors from from previous semesters and Meena is not helpful about those during office hours. Her video lectures are not good either. Take CS220 with Andy if you want to learn the content.

I think some here are conflating Meena and the class. Meena herself is awesome. That said, I agree that the class is a lot. Lecture is somehow both necessary yet not that useful. The projects are a lot and it is hard to catch up if you fall behind. The other prof is no different though, this is just a full-on course (yet worth it IMO!)

Meena is a poor professor. I would strongly advise not taking any course if she is the only professor. During her lectures she goes at 100 miles an hour, as she often shows up a few minutes late, or just as class starts, and then ends up keeping the class an equal time past when class is over. Very hard to follow and keep up with.

Meena is super kind and very accommodating to her students IF you reach out. She is very knowledgeable but I found myself not taking away much information from the 3 lectures per week. Not only that but the projects are very time consuming and I feel like the exams do not equate to what we focus on in lecture.

This class so ridiculously hard for a beginners class, and she was no help. Her lectures didn't actually teach anything, and the projects were incredibly time consuming and frustrating. I hated this class and dropped in four weeks from the end of semester because I got too behind on projects. I can't steer you away from this class enough.
She is not good at teaching fundamentals. I do not recommend her class for a freshman.
Very knowledgeable. Tough class overall, but worth it. She teaches a ton in the semester of time
She is not great for teaching programming concepts. ALL the work is done by other teaching staff. She has few office hours and frequently cancel those and is not helpful during OH at all.

Phenomenal professor who was very caring, meticulous, and accommodating. Extremely easy to approach and very thorough during code walks. I took CS367 (CS300 + CS400) during the Summer into 2017 which used to be one of the more failed classes before it was split into two due to it's intensity. Everything a professor should be.

Moves way too fast and has a very heavy accent that is hard to understand. If you are new to python, I would not recommend Meena. Lectures are pointless. She only goes over the base line for code and does not prepare you for exams or projects. Although she is really nice and accessible, grading is very tough and the class gets exponentially harder.
She has awful lectures, as in I watched one only during the whole semester ( I watched the others from another professor), however she is very caring and helpful. Respects students.

Meena is so sweet and caring she is also a great lecturer. Though projects can be very time consuming in this class it is very possible to get the grade you desire. This class was very fun and I would highly recommend taking it with meena.

Dont get me wrong , Meena is a great professor! She is very helpful , cares about her students, and has passion for what she does . However , the course itself was not the best , for somebody who has never had programming experience , I think this course was too much . The projects took more than 3 hours to complete each week and were pretty rough
She is one of the best professors I've had so far. Super accessible, accommodating and helpful. Her willingness to learn from student feedback is unmatched. HIGHLY recommended.

Meena is the sweetest. She is available outside of class, very knowledgable, and organized beyond belief. This was my first CS class and I was nervous, but I ended with an A. Watch the lectures and GO TO OFFICE HOURS FOR THE PROJECTS!!!! They were a life saver. The exams are difficult, but do-able. Meena is accommodating to the max and very kind!

Meena does an incredibly job with CS 220. The course website is SUPER organized, and its very easy to get help via piazza, email or office hours. Her lectures were a bit fast, but it was easy to fill in the gaps while working on the weekly projects. Would highly recommend to anyone interested in CS or just basic python or data science

Meena went above and beyond to make this course as informative and accommodating as possible during the pandemic. Through her lectures, her enthusiasm for computer science really shows. I would definitely take her again.

Meena is an awesome professor who is always there for her students. Like the other reviews say, this is by no means an easy class, especially with little to no Python experience. However, I can genuinely say, this is the first class I have ever taken in my academic career that values learning the necessary skills as opposed to just a letter grade.

One of the most organized and well run courses I have taken. Meena's lectures are straight forward and easy to understand. While the class is not easy, Meena and the TA's set you up for success through giving you everything you need to get a good grade. Office hours were available online to help with your projects most hours every day. Bravo.

Meena was an excellent professor that genuinely cares about students. I took this class with no python experience at all and she made all of the material able to be understood. There are a few tough topics for new programmers but nothing insanely hard. Take advantage of office hours/lab hours as those are the most helpful portion of the class.

This class is very well constructed for the online format, and all the grades and grading is very fair. Overall, I have no complaints about this class and I can tell Meena puts a lot of work into accommodating her students' wants/needs.

Meena is a really good professor and she really cares about her students, but this class moves extremely fast and is really difficult if you don't know python. I took this class because it is required for my major and my academic advisor recommended it. I would recommend having at least a base knowledge of python in order to be successful

Overall one of the best professors I've ever had. You can tell she really cares about her students and the material. She was able to communicate in a clear and effective manner and although the class moved rather fast, there was always someone to ask for advice, whether from a TA or Meena herself.
The class is quick-paced so take advantage of office hours. Meena is a very nice person though and her office hours definitely helped.

She moves way to fast in lecture so good luck keeping up. She will also spam you with well over 14 emails a week so be ready to sort. Grading is the harshest I've ever seen as an engineer with a 95% being an A (I got an AB with a 94.6%). On the plus side if you know basic python this class will be a breeze (minus the bugs in the test code)

The best thing I like most is Meena's teaching style. She is very organized and gives important notes in each class. I still remember the Sorting demonstrations in class with the students, It was fun and very helpful. Meena is very friendly and active. I would definitely recommend taking class with her.
Meena is a great instructor and very clear. I thought the projects were challenging and useful. I would definitely take her again as an instructor.

Meena was a great instructor and her lectures we organized very well. It was clear she really cared about the students and genuinely wanted us to all succeed and learn the material. She is definitely one of the best instructors I have had in four years of college and highly recommend taking a course with her if you can.

Meena is amazing! Her 367 is so useful! You learn how to use JAVA to finish projects based the partially structures she built for you. And you learn a lot of algorithms (although they are not deep enough). As a student who do not react quickly enough in class, I can also visit her in office hour and write down the notes I failed to catch in class.

Really responsive on Piazza and helpful in answering HW/conceptual questions. There's no textbook but wasn't necessary as Meenakshi was a very clear lecturer - didn't go too fast and drew helpful diagrams to trace code and explain certain algorithms. Programs and homeworks complemented the material well and the exams were straightforward.
Meena was a sweetheart and was the most responsive teacher that I have had in college. She cares about the success of the students and goes well out of her way to ensure people are learning.
Menna was literary the nicest professor I've had at UW. She really cares about her students and would want you to do well. The class itself was not at all difficult.  Great teacher. Great class!
